comments.raw_text:
I was watching a video* in Aurora 8.0a2 (2011-09-27, Built from http://hg.mozilla.org/releases/mozilla-aurora/rev/82893137d4b0).

When the video completed, I clicked through to one of the videos that was presented in the same Flash window.  The browser hung (spinning wheel of death).

So I force-closed Aurora and one-by-one disabled my addons, restarted, reproduced the hang, repeat until none were left enabled.  Aurora still hung when performing the actions above.

Then I tried Help | Restart with Addons Disabled and performed the same actions - no hang.  So, what is the difference between manually disabling all addons and restarting with addons disabled?


* http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m9OAByxkIyw
comments.author: jhopkins@mozilla.com

comments.text: The "Restart with Addons Disabled" menu item restarts into Firefox safe mode where all extensions are disabled, but safe mode also disables the JIT, graphics acceleration, and userContent.css/userChrome.css.
